1.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
to test; by implication, to attempt
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb

2.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
wine (as fermented); by implication, intoxication
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
wisdom (in a good sense)
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
silliness
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

where? hence how?
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
a feeding upon, i.e. grasping after

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
